meanings.definition: To rise to the surface and float
meanings.sent1: The oil will supernate on top of the water.
meanings.sent2: After shaking the bottle, the bubbles will supernate.
meanings.sent3: The rubber duck seemed to supernate effortlessly in the bathtub.
meanings.sent4: Her happiness seemed to supernate from within her.
meanings.sent5: The colorful leaves supernated on the calm lake, creating a beautiful sight.

meanings.definition: To settle or deposit as sediment
meanings.sent1: The sand will supernate at the bottom of the glass.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the particles will supernate and form a layer.
meanings.sent3: The idea seemed to supernate in his mind, slowly settling into place.
meanings.sent4: The memories supernated in her heart, creating a sense of nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The dust particles supernated on the old book, revealing its age.

meanings.definition: To separate from a liquid by settling or floating
meanings.sent1: The cream will supernate from the milk if left undisturbed.
meanings.sent2: The impurities will supernate and can be easily removed.
meanings.sent3: The glitter seemed to supernate from the glue, creating a magical effect.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts seemed to supernate from the chaos, bringing clarity.
meanings.sent5: The oil supernated on the soup, making it easy to skim off.
